intro: Spilanthes iodiscaea, commonly known as the yellow toothbrush plant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes, which is part of the sunflower family, Asteraceae. The plant is characterized by its yellow, toothbrush-like flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Spilanthes iodiscaea is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is thought to deter herbivores.
